tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten express postcard from Schenker to Felix Salzer, dated October 10, 1933

tei:transcription.tei:p: [An:] H. [/] D^r^ [/] Felix Salzer Wien, XIII Maxingstr. 12^II/^
[postmark recto x 2:] || 3 WIEN 40 | 10. X. 33. 15 | 7b || [postmark verso:] || 13/1 WIEN 39 | 10. X. 33. 13 | Pb || [gummed stamp recto:] Durch Eilboten [/] Exprès.

{verso} Mein lieber D^r^ Salzer! The writing of this postcard is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 4/7, p. 3873, in response to an express postcard from Salzer received the previous day (OJ 4/7, pp. 3872-3873): "möchte mich vor Freitag sprechen" ("would like to speak to me before Friday").

Stehe Donnerstag, 11^h^, herzlichst gern zur Verfügung. Aus vielen Gründen geht es nicht früher, so zufällig sie auch sind, He was seeing Moriz Violin and looking at an apartment in the Türkenschanze on the Tuesday, and had a woman coming to clean the music room and ante-room on the Wednesday (OJ 4/7, p. 3873). ich habe leider keine Macht, sie zu beseitigen. Also, ich erwarte Sie am Donnerstag! Schenker's diary for Thursday, October 12, 1933 (OJ 4/7, p. 3873), records: "Von 11-12^h^: D^r^ Salzer kommt mich begrüßen." ("From 11 to 12 o'clock: Dr. Salzer comes to pay his respects" [at the start of the new season].)
Auf Wiedersehen Ihr [signed:] H. Schenker 10. 10. 33

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten express postcard from Schenker to Felix Salzer, dated October 10, 1933

tei:translation.tei:p: [To:] Dr. Felix Salzer Vienna XIII, Maxingstrasse 12^II^
[postmark recto x 2:] || 3 WIEN 40 | 10. X. 33. 15 | 7b || [postmark verso:] || 13/1 WIEN 39 | 10. X. 33. 13 | Pb || [gummed stamp recto:] Special Delivery [/] Express.

I would be very pleased to make myself available to you on Thursday at 11 o'clock. It is not possible earlier, for various reasons; as incidental as these may be, I just can't put them off. So I expect you on Thursday!
Till later, Yours, [signed:] H. Schenker October 10, 1933
